Economic Disruption: Businesses would struggle to operate without customers who remember their products or services.
Loss of Cultural Heritage: Without memories, people would lose their connection to history, art, and literature.
Environmental Disaster: Without memories of past environmental disasters, people might not take necessary precautions to prevent future ones.
Technological Regression: Without memories of technological advancements, society might revert to more primitive methods.
Emotional Crisis: Without memories of personal experiences, people might struggle to form emotional connections with others.
